reviews.review: geilheit

The decision on whether or not to recommend this game was a difficult one to make. I always struggled to make it through, personally, as while the game was truly a marvel of its time and paved the way for a decade and a half of first person shooters drawing inspiration, the years certainly haven't been kind to it. The poor level design, lack of atmosphere in some areas, infuriating friendly AI, and complete lack of restraint on Valve's part when placing enemies around levels were particular pain points. 

However, despite this, I do believe Half Life 2 is worth playing. It's not easy to get through without mods, but the last segment of the game at least alleviates the relative pain of the previous chapters. Personally, I played without mods, as I wanted to experience the game as it was originally intended to be played-- but if you don't have the stomach for that (which is completely understandable), then MMod is a great way to modernize some of the gameplay and keep things fresh.

Half life 2 is the best, mot fun game you have ever played, for the first time you play it. The story and atmosphere does an amazing job of immersing you into this world that Valve has crafted which is great. The biggest flaw with this game however is the gameplay/combat. It's pretty shit. The amazing set pieces and presentation of the game does a great job at distracting you from this, but only for your first and second playthrough, after that you realise how mediocre the shooting elements can be. But at the end of the day it's a game that everyone should experience, along with episode 1 and 2.

Half-Life 2, and all its proponents, are not perfect. The game can get stale, the enemies can become repetitive, the weapons can feel weak, but the same can be said about any game. The purpose of this game's existence at the time was a show of physics; it bridged the lines between what a physics engine could deem valid and what a critic could deem fun. I would argue that this game does it shockingly well. It has held up, at least for the most part, and is still a fun and exciting game to play. I would heavily recommend it to those who haven't played it yet. Even today, it is still a remarkable game.

9/10

A great, classic, single-player, first-person shooter. The science fiction story draws you in as you try to figure out what's happened to the world around you. The difficulty is fairly easy but the game is more about the story. There are plenty of interesting mechanics and memorable moments. The gun-play is buttery smooth. This game still holds up years later.
